Hatter's Party Scarf

$2.50 • Buy Hatter's Party Scarf now! Pattern Purchase FAQ View on Ravelry

Inspired by the recent interest in Alice in Wonderland, Hatter’s Party Scarf is fit for a very important date!

I love fringe, and I love long, triangular style scarves with a slight scoop, which is why Hatter’s Party Scarf is not a harsh triangle. Hatter’s Party Scarf is a combination of these many wonderful things, and is a great way to use one skein of colorful sock yarn, or two skeins of a luxury worsted weight.

When knitting this scarf, I’d recommend using a slightly variegated yarn and purling the right side stitches that are in the different color (and knitting the wrong side stitches that are in the different color).

Keep in mind that the stitches that fall after the marker on the right side rows (which will be before the marker on wrong side rows) should remain as written. The last 5 stitches will be dropped, and the twisted knit stitch helps to keep a nice even edge.

You can knit this scarf using any yarn weight you like, provided you have a scale or some method of estimating the remaining amount of yarn. See the information below on substitutions and changes.

Instructions are included to swap out yarn weights so you can use any yarn in your stash.

Originally this pattern was only available with a Femme Fatale Fibers purchase, but I’ve made it available for purchase online due to the number of requests I’ve received for the pattern.

Pattern Information

Gauge

28 stitches and 32 rows = 4 inches in stockinette

Yardage

350 - 500 yards Fingering / 4 ply (14 wpi)

Yarns

Femme Fatale Fibers Lilith Sock (Fingering)

Needles

US 8 - 5.0 mm

Sizes

One size (scarf)

Photos

Comments

comments powered by Disqus




About pattern purchases

Patterns are sold as downloadable PDF files through Ravelry, with payments processed by PayPal. You do not need an account to use either service.

If you have a Ravelry account, I suggest logging in prior to purchasing so that patterns are added to your library.

Get pattern help

Pattern support is provided free of charge for all of my patterns. We respond as quickly as possible, but sometimes it can take a day or two.

Submit a new help request through Zendesk.

You can also use Zendesk to report errors and ask non-technical questions.

Alternatively, you can try the Ravelry group.

Support is only provided via Zendesk.

FAQ

Can I teach a class using your knitting pattern?

Teaching licensing is temporarily on hold and should resume in 2014.

Can I sell items made using your knitting patterns for profit or charity?

Not at this time.

How do I order wholesale copies for my LYS?

Pattern wholesaling is temporarily on hold and should resume in 2014.

I found an error, how do I report it?

Oh newts! Submit your error through Zendesk and we will fix it.

Happy knitting!
